notes.text: An update is now available for Red Hat Ceph Storage 8.0.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Ceph Storage is a scalable, open, software-defined storage platform that combines the most stable version of the Ceph storage system with a Ceph management platform, deployment utilities, and support services. 
 
These new packages include numerous enhancements, bug fixes, and known issues. Space precludes documenting all of these changes in this advisory. Users are directed to the Red Hat Ceph Storage Release Notes for information on the most significant of these changes:

https://docs.redhat.com/en/documentation/red_hat_ceph_storage/8/html/8.0_release_notes
notes.title: Details

notes.title: Terms of Use

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat products and services.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat Ceph Storage 8.0 security update

notes.text: A vulnerability in the Ceph Rados Gateway (RadosGW) OIDC provider allows attackers to bypass JWT signature verification by supplying a token with "none" as the algorithm (alg). This occurs because the implementation fails to enforce strict signature validation, enabling attackers to forge valid tokens without a signature.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ceph: rhceph-container: Authentication bypass in CEPH RadosGW
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously released errata relevant to your system have been applied.

For details on how to apply this update, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

For supported configurations, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/1548993

vulnerabilities.title: ceph: rhceph-container: Authentication bypass in CEPH RadosGW
